prompts.best_practices: Role overview, key responsibilities (5-8 bullets), qualifications (required vs. preferred separate), salary range, benefits, location/remote options. Inclusive language ('encouraged to apply'). Mission-driven framing. Avoid unnecessary degree requirements. 400-600 words. Include EEO statement. Emphasize mission/impact over prestige.
prompts.why_it_matters: Quality job descriptions attract better candidates and reduce mis-hires. Inclusive JDs expand talent pool 30-50%. Clear expectations reduce employee turnover. Professional JDs signal organizational competence. Good JDs are template for performance reviews. Hiring mistakes are extremely costly for small organizations.

prompts.title: Employee Handbook Section
prompts.description: Policy section for staff handbook (PTO, remote work, etc.)
prompts.pain_points: Legal compliance across multiple jurisdictions. Balancing flexibility with clarity. Writing policies that are enforceable but humane. Addressing all scenarios without 100-page handbook. Keeping current with changing laws. Board approval process. Accessible language vs. legal precision.
prompts.best_practices: Clear policy statement. Rationale/purpose. Eligibility/scope. Procedures. Exceptions process. Review date. Legal review essential (at least annually). Plain language. 1-2 pages per section. Common sections: PTO, sick leave, remote work, harassment, grievance, confidentiality. Acknowledgment form.
prompts.why_it_matters: Employee handbooks protect organization legally and create consistent staff experience. Clear policies prevent conflicts and misunderstandings. Handbooks are required for best-practice HR. Quality policies improve staff retention. Handbook gaps create legal liability. Professional handbook demonstrates organizational maturity.

prompts.title: Performance Review Template
prompts.description: Structured annual employee evaluation form
prompts.pain_points: EDs uncomfortable with performance management. Balancing positive feedback with areas for growth. Making reviews developmental not punitive. Documenting performance issues appropriately. Tying reviews to compensation with limited budget. Time-intensive with multiple reports. Subjectivity vs. objective criteria.
prompts.best_practices: Competency-based (3-5 areas aligned to role). Rating scale (exceeds/meets/developing). Self-assessment component. Goal review from last year + new goals. Comments sections. Strengths and development areas. 90-day check-ins for new hires. Annual for established staff. 1-hour discussion minimum. Documentation essential.
prompts.why_it_matters: Regular performance reviews improve staff development and retention. Reviews create accountability and clarity. Documented reviews protect organization in termination situations. Quality reviews increase employee engagement. Reviews align individual work with organizational strategy. Review process demonstrates professional management.

prompts.title: Remote Work Policy
prompts.description: Guidelines for flexible/hybrid/remote work arrangements
prompts.pain_points: Post-COVID expectations for flexibility. Balancing remote work with program needs (some roles can't be remote). Equity across positions. Maintaining culture and collaboration remotely. Technology/security requirements. Performance management when not co-located. Board skepticism of remote productivity.
prompts.best_practices: Define eligible positions. Core hours vs. flexible hours. Remote/hybrid/in-office options by role. Communication expectations (response times, meetings). Technology requirements and support. Workspace and ergonomics. Performance standards same regardless of location. Trial periods. Review annually. 2-3 pages.
prompts.why_it_matters: Remote work flexibility is now competitive requirement for talent attraction. Clear policies prevent resentment and confusion. Remote options expand geographic talent pool. Flexibility improves work-life balance and retention. Hybrid policies are cost-neutral or reduce office overhead. Policy clarity protects organization and employees.

prompts.title: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP)
prompts.description: Step-by-step process documentation for recurring task
prompts.pain_points: Institutional knowledge lives in one person's head. Staff turnover creates crisis when no documentation. Time-intensive to write when you could just do the task. Keeping SOPs current as processes evolve. Balancing detail with usability. Knowing what needs SOP vs. what doesn't.
prompts.best_practices: Purpose of procedure. When/how often performed. Who performs. Step-by-step instructions (numbered). Screenshots/visuals helpful. Tools/systems used. Troubleshooting common issues. Related procedures. Version date and owner. Review annually. Store centrally (shared drive). 1-3 pages typical.
prompts.why_it_matters: SOPs protect against staff turnover knowledge loss. Documentation enables delegation and training. SOPs reduce errors and increase consistency. Quality SOPs demonstrate operational maturity to funders. SOPs allow vacation coverage without crisis. Process documentation saves massive time during transitions.

prompts.title: New Employee Onboarding Checklist
prompts.description: Structured onboarding for new staff members
prompts.pain_points: New hires overwhelmed and unclear where to start. Inconsistent onboarding creates confusion. Critical tasks forgotten (IT access, key card, tax forms). Training while maintaining own workload. Making new hire feel welcomed not processed. Coordinating cross-team introductions. Measuring onboarding effectiveness.
prompts.best_practices: Pre-start: IT setup, workspace, handbook. Day 1: welcome, paperwork, mission intro, team meetings. Week 1: systems training, program overview, policies. Month 1: goal-setting, check-ins. Include: task, owner, deadline. Welcome letter from ED. Onboarding buddy. 30/60/90-day check-ins. Feedback loops.
prompts.why_it_matters: Quality onboarding increases retention from 50% to 80%+. First week sets engagement and performance patterns. Systematic onboarding ensures compliance and reduces legal risk. Good onboarding accelerates time-to-productivity. New hires who feel supported become long-term employees. Onboarding demonstrates organizational culture and professionalism.

prompts.title: Meeting Agenda Template
prompts.description: Structured agenda for effective staff meetings
prompts.pain_points: Meetings run long and accomplish little. Unclear objectives lead to rambling. People show up unprepared. Too much time on updates, not enough on problem-solving. Getting staff to actually follow agenda. Meeting fatigue. Balancing inclusion with efficiency.
prompts.best_practices: Clear objective for meeting. Time-boxed agenda items. Pre-reads noted. Decision vs. discussion vs. FYI labeled. Include breaks for 90+ min meetings. Parking lot for off-topic items. Action items with owners at end. Send agenda 2-3 days advance. Weekly staff meetings 60-90 min max. Template ensures consistency.
prompts.why_it_matters: Meetings consume 25-40% of staff time. Quality agendas can cut meeting time 30% while improving outcomes. Structured meetings respect staff time and boost morale. Good agendas enable participation and decision-making. Meeting discipline signals organizational professionalism. Reducing meeting waste is immediate productivity gain.
